subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Letter for "er" as in earth?
msgSnippet: ... Thanks Moira. The mistake results because I typed in a capital Z in the html rather than a small z. The font itself is okay in this respect. Here is
messageBody:
Test for Shawtwo font Test

Test for Shawtwo Font

This page tests the font Shawtwo (which may latter be renamed).

Below are the 40 glyps plus two ligatures in large type. On each line you should see one a number, followed by a colon, followed by the QS character that corresponds to that number according to Read's orignal manual.

1:p

2:b

3:t

4:d

5:k

6:g

7:T

8:H

9:f

10:v

11:s

12:z

13:S

14:Z

15:c

16:J

17:j

18:w

19:h

20:`

21:N

22:m

23:n

24:l

25:r

26:i

27:I

28:e

29:E

30:A

31:F

32:y

33:Y

34:o

35:q

36:a

37:Q

38:O

39:U

40:M

17+40:V

29+25:X

Moira O'Brien wrote:
> 
> 
> Just a little error Paul:
>  
> No 12 should be Z-oo but is showing the same as 14.
>  

Thanks Moira. The mistake results because I typed in a capital "Z" in 
the html rather than a small "z." The font itself is okay in this 
respect. Here is the test.html that corrects that mistake.

Paul
